revised_title: Measuring Heights with the Barometer: Experiments and Observations by William Roy
tldr: In this article, William Roy conducts experiments to determine a rule for measuring heights using a barometer. He discusses the expansion of quicksilver in barometer tubes and the impact of temperature on the measurements. Roy also compares his findings with those of Mr. De Luc and presents his own method for calculating altitude based on the barometer readings and temperature adjustments.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Atmospheric Science
